        Description copied from interface: DocumentCollection
        Gets a specified document in a collection.

        This method gets a document in a document collection that is the same as a reference document that does not necessarily come from the collection (for example, a document retrieved from another collection).

        Specified by:
        getDocument in interface DocumentCollection
        Parameters:
        doc - The Document you are looking for
        Returns:
        The specified Document from the collection,If the reference document is not in the collection, you get a null return.

      • FTSearch

        public void FTSearch(String query)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentCollection
        Conducts a full-text search of all the documents in a document collection, and reduces the collection to a sorted collection of those documents that match.

        Note: This method moves the current pointer to the first document in the collection.

        The collection of documents that match the full-text query are sorted by relevance, with highest relevance first. You can access the relevance score of each document in the collection using Document.getFTSearchScore() Document.

        If the database is not full-text indexed, this method works, but less efficiently. To test for an index, use

        Specified by:
        FTSearch in interface DocumentCollection
        Parameters:
        query - The full-text query. Database.isFTIndexed(). To create an index on a local database, use Database.updateFTIndex(boolean)

        This method searches all documents in a document collection. To search all documents in a database, use Database.FTSearch(String) in Database. To search only documents found in a particular view, use View.FTSearch(String) in View or ViewEntryCollection.FTSearch(String) in ViewEntryCollection.

        Query syntax
        To search for a word or phrase, enter the word or phrase as is, except that search keywords must be enclosed in quotes. Remember to escape quotes if you are inside a literal.

        Wildcards, operators, and other syntax are permitted. For the complete syntax rules, see "Refining a search query using operators" in Notes� Help. Search for "query syntax" in the Domino� Designer Eclipse help system or information center (for example, http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/domhelp/v8r0/index.jsp), both of which include Notes.

      • FTSearch

        public void FTSearch(String query,
            int maxDocs)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentCollection
        Conducts a full-text search of all the documents in a document collection, and reduces the collection to a sorted collection of those documents that match.

        Note: This method moves the current pointer to the first document in the collection.

        The collection of documents that match the full-text query are sorted by relevance, with highest relevance first. You can access the relevance score of each document in the collection using Document.getFTSearchScore() Document.

        If the database is not full-text indexed, this method works, but less efficiently. To test for an index, use

        Specified by:
        FTSearch in interface DocumentCollection
        Parameters:
        query - The full-text query.
        maxDocs - The maximum number of documents you want returned from the query. Set this parameter to 0 to receive all matching documents. Database.isFTIndexed(). To create an index on a local database, use Database.updateFTIndex(boolean)

        This method searches all documents in a document collection. To search all documents in a database, use Database.FTSearch(String) in Database. To search only documents found in a particular view, use View.FTSearch(String) in View or ViewEntryCollection.FTSearch(String) in ViewEntryCollection.

        Query syntax
        To search for a word or phrase, enter the word or phrase as is, except that search keywords must be enclosed in quotes. Remember to escape quotes if you are inside a literal.

        Wildcards, operators, and other syntax are permitted. For the complete syntax rules, see "Refining a search query using operators" in Notes� Help. Search for "query syntax" in the Domino� Designer Eclipse help system or information center (for example, http://publib.boulder.ibm.com/infocenter/domhelp/v8r0/index.jsp), both of which include Notes.

      • isSorted

        public boolean isSorted()
        Description copied from interface: DocumentCollection
        Indicates whether the documents in a collection are sorted. A collection is sorted only when it results from a full-text search.

        When a collection is sorted, the documents are sorted by relevance score with the most relevant document appearing first. A relevance score is a number assigned to each document that matches a particular full-text search query. The number is related to the number of matches that were found in the document.

        Specified by:
        isSorted in interface DocumentCollection
        Returns:
        Returns true if the collection is sorted and false if it is not sorted.

      • putAllInFolder

        public void putAllInFolder(String folderName)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentCollection
        Adds all the documents in the collection to the specified folder. If the folder does not exist in the document's database, it is created.

        If a document is already inside the folder you specify, putAllInFolder does nothing for that document.

        Specified by:
        putAllInFolder in interface DocumentCollection
        Parameters:
        folderName - The name of the folder in which to place the documents. If the folder is within another folder, specify a path to it, separating folder names with backward slashes, for example, "Vehicles\\Bikes".

      • putAllInFolder

        public void putAllInFolder(String folderName,
                  boolean createOnFail)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentCollection
        Adds all the documents in the collection to the specified folder. If the folder does not exist in the document's database, it is created.

        If a document is already inside the folder you specify, putAllInFolder does nothing for that document.

        Specified by:
        putAllInFolder in interface DocumentCollection
        Parameters:
        folderName - The name of the folder in which to place the documents. If the folder is within another folder, specify a path to it, separating folder names with backward slashes, for example, "Vehicles\\Bikes".
        createOnFail - If true (default), creates the folder if it does not exist.

      • removeAll

        public void removeAll(boolean force)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentCollection
        Permanently removes the documents in a collection from a database.

        This method moves the current pointer to the first document in the collection.

        All documents removed from the database as a result of this operation are also removed from the collection.

        Specified by:
        removeAll in interface DocumentCollection
        Parameters:
        force - If true, a document is removed even if another user modifies the document after it is retrieved. If false, a document is not removed if another user modifies it first.

      • removeAllFromFolder

        public void removeAllFromFolder(String folderName)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentCollection
        Removes all documents in the collection from the specified folder.

        This method moves the current pointer to the first document in the collection.

        The method does nothing for documents not in the folder you specify. This method does nothing if the folder you specify does not exist.

        Specified by:
        removeAllFromFolder in interface DocumentCollection
        Parameters:
        folderName - The name of the folder from which to remove the document. If the folder is within another folder, specify a path to it, separating folder names with backward slashes. For example, "Vehicles\\Bikes".

      • stampAll

        public void stampAll(String itemName,
            Object value)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentCollection
        Replaces the value of a specified item in all documents in a collection.

        This method moves the current pointer to the first document in the collection.

        If the item does not exist, it is created.

        The item values are immediately written to the server documents. You do not have to use the save method of Document after stampAll. However, any documents modified by your script must be saved before calling stampAll.

        This method does not modify existing Document objects. Documents must be retrieved again to see the changes.

        Specified by:
        stampAll in interface DocumentCollection
        Parameters:
        itemName - The name of the item.
        value - A value appropriate for the item type. @see org.openntf.domino.Document#replaceItemValue(String, Object)}.

        Description copied from interface: DocumentCollection
        Marks all documents in a collection as processed by an agent.
        Specified by:
        updateAll in interface DocumentCollection

      • getUntilTime

        public DateTime getUntilTime()
        Description copied from interface: DocumentCollection
        The database end time for a collection obtained through Database.getModifiedDocuments() in Database.

        This time should be specified as the "since" time in a subsequent call to Database.getModifiedDocuments() where you want to get all modified documents since the most recent call.

        The database time may differ from the system time. Do not use the system time in

        Specified by:
        getUntilTime in interface DocumentCollection
        Returns:
        Returns the end time for a collection obtained through Database.getModifiedDocuments(), For collections not produced through Database.getModifiedDocuments(), this property returns null. Database.getModifiedDocuments() where you want to get all modified documents since the most recent call.

      • markAllRead

        public void markAllRead(String userName)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentCollection
        Marks all the documents in a collection read.

        If the database does not track unread marks, all documents are considered read, and this method has no effect.

        Specified by:
        markAllRead in interface DocumentCollection
        Parameters:
        userName - Marks all the documents in the collection as read on behalf of the given name.

      • intersect

        public void intersect(int noteId)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentCollection
        Removes from a document collection any documents not also contained in a second collection.

        The document or documents being intersected by this method must be in the same database as the original collection. Otherwise, the method will return the error "the specified note or notes do not exist in the database" or, if a noteID was passed to the method that matches a noteID in the original collection's database, the method will use the unintended document.

        On successful completion of this method, the original document collection will contain only the documents it contained prior to the call which are also contained in the input argument.

        Specified by:
        intersect in interface DocumentCollection
        Parameters:
        noteId - A single noteID belonging to the DocumentCollection's database.

      • intersect

        public void intersect(String noteId)
        Description copied from interface: DocumentCollection
        Removes from a document collection any documents not also contained in a second collection.

        The document or documents being intersected by this method must be in the same database as the original collection. Otherwise, the method will return the error "the specified note or notes do not exist in the database" or, if a noteID was passed to the method that matches a noteID in the original collection's database, the method will use the unintended document.

        On successful completion of this method, the original document collection will contain only the documents it contained prior to the call which are also contained in the input argument.

        Specified by:
        intersect in interface DocumentCollection
        Parameters:
        noteId - A single noteID belonging to the DocumentCollection's database.
